summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Rio Bravo Review Date: 2006/10/27 Store: John Wayne (Actor), Dean Martin (Actor), Howard Hawks (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles Product Description: ['Rio Bravo (Widescreen) (Sous-titres français)'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Howard Hawks', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, DVD, Subtitled, Widescreen, Closed-captioned, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 8, 2001', 'Actors': 'John Wayne, Dean Martin, Ricky Nelson, Angie Dickinson, Walter Brennan', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Unqualified (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'B.H. McCampbell, Jules Furthman, Leigh Brackett', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I first saw this movie in the early 60s, when I was a young kid, and it stayed in my mind. It's that good. I recently saw it with my 11 year old son, and he just loved it; this boy normally won't watch westerns. It's that good.

John Wayne, Dean Martin, Walter Brennan all do a great job. Even Rick Nelson, not someone you'd expect to see in a western, does a solid job. Angie Dickinson is very likable. It all hangs together, and doesn't work too hard at it; just goes down nice and easy. (Ok, I mixed my metaphors, but you get the drift.)

What can I say, I love this movie! If you like the classic ones, buy it, it's worth every penny. Review Title: if you like the classic westerns, this is a must-see, must-own Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: District B13/District 13: Ultimatum 2-Pack Review Date: 2012/03/10 Store: Cyril Raffaelli (Actor), David Belle (Actor), Patrick Alessandrin (Director), Pierre Morel (Director) & 1 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Includes: District B13 Paris, 2010. An isolation wall surrounds the ghetto cities of District B13. Within these walls, without effective law enforcement, gang rule is absolute. Damien is a member of an elite police squadron, highly trained in martial arts. He goes undercover to infiltrate a gang in order to defuse a neutron bomb and save District B13 from annihilation. Damien recruits the help of a criminal named Leito - whose only goal is to save his sister from the clutches of the same gang. District 13: Ultimatum Two years have passed since elite police officer Damien Tomasso (Cyril Raffaelli) teamed up with reformed vigilante Leito (David Belle) to save the notorious District 13, a racially charged ghetto populated by violent drug dealing gangs and vicious killers. Despite government promises to maintain order, the state of the district has deteriorated and is causing civil unrest. A group of corrupt cops and elected officials conspire to cash in on the redevelopment of the district by proposing it's destruction under the nuclear air strike. Damien and Leito must join forces again, using their martial arts and unique physical skills, to bring peace to the neighborhood by any means necessary."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MGNO10299BR', 'Director': 'Patrick Alessandrin, Pierre Morel', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '3 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 27, 2010', 'Actors': 'Cyril Raffaelli, David Belle, Philippe Torreton, Daniel Duval, Elodie Yung', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Magnolia Home Ent', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Yes, I do mean that: these are among the best action movies ever made -- but I'll qualify by adding "which involve humans doing athletic things", such as martial arts movies. (I like the other kinds too, BTW.)

But if you enjoy watching incredibly gifted athletes doing great stunts done in a very believable way, and don't mind preposterous plots, then these movies might tickle your fancy. Just being able to watch David Belle (said to be the founder of parkour/parcour) is worth the price in my opinion.

So remember, don't expect any Profound Commentary on the Human Condition (thank goodness). Don't get too hung up on the silliness or the stereotypes, that's part of the fun. Just relax and enjoy great escapist fun with a good companion or two. Review Title: silly plots, but among the best action movies ever made Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/04/20 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Ferland', 'Christine Moore', 'John Polson', 'Ron Fortunato', 'Seith Mann', 'Jerry Levine', 'Larry Teng', 'Lucy Liu', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Andrew Bernstein'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: If you're a fan of the Sherlock Holmes stories, and don't object to a well-done transformation of the theme, then you are likely to really enjoy this series. The acting is superb, the stories are compelling, and the whole thing just reeks of excellence and attention to detail.

I've been a fan of the Holmes stories since I was a little boy, having read all of them multiple times, and have watched the various film versions over the years. I've enjoyed some of them: I'm not a big fan of the Basil Rathbone versions, and I quite disliked the Guy Ritchie/Robert Downey versions. I think that the recent re-imagining done in this series and in the British series (by Gatiss/Moffat, with Benedict Cumberbatch & Martin Freeman) are excellent, and hugely enjoyable if you're not offended by the variation from the canonical texts. Review Title: Very good revised version of Holmes & Watson Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/09/28 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Attenborough', 'Richard'], 'Producers': ['Richard Attenborough'], 'Starring': ['Ben Kingsley', 'Candice Bergen', 'Edward Fox'], 'Studio': ['Classics']} Review Text: Gandhi was human, and had his weaknesses. But you wouldn't know it from this movie, this is about Gandhi the soon-to-revered, and presents him as someone just barely short of being a god. I would have preferred him presented as a great man, with all his compassion and leadership and steadfastness, but also with some human weaknesses.

Further, although I don't want to go into the history in a brief review (there are many authoritative sources for those who might be interested), but the portrayal of events, and of the other important players, is a bit too slick and shallow. It does great disservice to a worldwide audience that is unlikely to hear another version of the story. Review Title: A bit too much worship. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/10/19 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Owen Morris', 'Robert Chetwyn', 'Martyn Friend', 'Ronald Wilson', 'Ken Hannam', 'Christopher Hodson', 'Robert Tronson'], 'Producers': ['Ken Riddington', 'Jonathan Alwyn'], 'Studio': ['BBC']} Review Text: I read all the Allingham books & stories many years ago, and enjoyed them greatly. So I was quite pleased to find these televised versions ... at least, until I started watching them. They are abysmal. The director and the actors seem to have completely missed the spirit of the stories, the acting is wooden, and the whole thing comes across as rather lame.

If you're a Campion fan, give this a miss. If you're not a Campion fan, give it a wide berth. Review Title: poorly done Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/02/28 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Kay', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Allan Kroeker', 'Jamie Barber', 'Emile B. Levisetti', 'Kate Woods', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Christopher Gorham', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Starring': ['Piper Perabo', 'Christopher Gorham', 'Peter Gallagher'], 'Studio': ['USA']} Review Text: The writers didn't even bother reading spy thrillers to learn a bit about spycraft, guess they care more about the soap opera aspects of the show. Piper Perabo is not convincing in the role, she plays it as "sorority girl tries hard in the CIA". The surrounding cast is rather good, they help carry the show, expecially Chris Gorham in the buddy and mentor role (he's rather charming, appeals to both genders in my family).

I gave up after Perabo's character looked confused at an airport briefcase switch (calling it a brush-pass doesn't make it authentic), because more than one person had similar briefcases. Even trainees in an exercise would have planned it better and handled it better. Review Title: lame. really lame. Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/23 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Satsuo Yamamoto'], 'Producers': ['Itsuo Doi', 'Takerô Itô', 'Masaichi Nagata'], 'Starring': ['Raizo Ichikawa', 'Shiho Fujimura', 'Tomisaburo Wakayama'], 'Studio': ['AnimEigo', 'Inc']} Review Text: Dumb story, poor quality film (it's very dark and hard to see). Diehard fans of the genre might be interested for the historical significance of the series, but although I like many Japanese movies of the type (jidaigeki), I found this one heavy going. Review Title: avoid unless you're a true fan of old ninja movies Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/31 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Christopher Menaul', 'Gillies MacKinnon'], 'Producers': ['Lynda La Plante', 'Liz Thorburn'], 'Starring': ['Kelly Reilly', 'Ciaran Hinds', 'Shaun Dingwell'], 'Studio': ['Acorn Media']} Review Text: For some reason I don't quite understand, Brit thrillers are really gory and brutal -- the bad guys like to really hurt and damage people ... especially young women. (I'm trying not to draw broad conclusions from this.) To me that's just a kind of porn, I don't see how it adds entertainment value to a crime drama.

Anyway, the acting and real-world feel of this series is just excellent. Kelly Reilly does a great job of being the bright young constable who isn't always sure of herself, and the other principal characters are very believable. However, the plots are relatively weak (maybe that's why the gore is needed, to heighten the drama?), and the finish doesn't quite live up to the promise.

Just not compelling enough for my tastes, but again, the actors make it worth watching if you have nothing better to do. Review Title: meh (not wonderful, but not terrible, either) Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/04 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Wolfgang Petersen'], 'Producers': ['Dieter Geissler', 'Bernd Eichinger'], 'Starring': ['Alan Oppenheimer', 'Noah Hathaway', 'Barret Oliver']} Review Text: Dumb story, poorly directed and acted, there was really nothing to redeem this horror. I can't believe it got so many good ratings from so many viewers. I feel I need to erase my memory, it was so bad. Review Title: really dumb and poorly done Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Lorenz'], 'Producers': ['Tim Moore', 'Clint Eastwood', 'Michele Weisler'], 'Starring': ['Clint Eastwood', 'Amy Adams', 'Justin Timberlake']} Review Text: Well crafted, well acted, nice mellow story. A very enjoyable movie. The plot is along familiar lines, but very well done, despite the somewhat fairy tale ending (all the bad people get their comeuppance, the good people triumph). Amy Adams and Eastwood are super as a father-daughter pair trying to connect, and the supporting cast is terrific. Review Title: A very enjoyable mellow movie (good date movie, perhaps) Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/25 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Hare'], 'Producers': ['David Heyman'], 'Starring': ['Ralph Fiennes', 'Rachel Weisz', 'Bill Nighy'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']} Review Text: Very well-made in a typically Brit style, but the story is stupid and shallow, there's not much to hold your attention. (Unless you're a big fan of the fashionably lefty entertainment crowd's view of the world with the US and Israel as evil partners; I'm not.) If you want a good Brit-style spy thriller, it would be much better to watch Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (either version). Heck, I'd rather watch that for the 7th time than waste time on this one. Review Title: dumb shallow story, a waste of some good actors Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/09/28 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Doris Day', 'Brenda de Banzie'], 'Studio': ['Universal City Studios Product']} Review Text: I remembered seeing this some decades ago, when I was quite young, and only vaguely remembered the story, with some scenes rather vivid in my memory. So I watched it again with eager anticipation. Sadly, I was very disappointed. The story is dumb, really really dumb, even for the period. The lead couple (Stewart & Day) behave irrationally, and so does everyone else -- the police, the bad guys, the bystanders -- it's just hard to take. I also thought there was a whiff of "Ugly American" in the behavior of the McKennas, but there's no point belaboring that point in an old movie. It was not a fun revisit. Review Title: really dumb, doesn't stand the test of time Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Brothers Grimm Review Date: 2015/08/13 Categories: Suspense, Comedy, Dreamlike, Ambitious Product Description: ['The rollicking tale of two con-artist brothers who sell protection from menacing spirits to gullible small towns - a profitable business until they must battle real evil creatures in a haunted forest!'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Terry Gilliam'], 'Producers': ['John D. Schofield', 'Daniel Bobker', 'Charles Roven', 'Chuck Roven'], 'Starring': ['Matt Damon', 'Heath Ledger', 'Lena Headey']} Review Text: Oh my goodness, it is really bad! I should have known, its directed by Terry Gilliam, who could take Hamlet and and destroy it completely. (Why anyone hired or funded that man despite his track record of failure is a question that now torments me.)

No, really, it is abysmal, and a colossal waste of great acting talent. The story is haphazard, the acting uncertain, the direction feckless.

Give it a miss, your life will be better for it. Review Title: Bad, bad, bad. Just avoid. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Murder At 1600 Review Date: 2015/08/14 Categories: Drama, Action, Anxious, Intense Product Description: ['When a veteran Washington D.C. police detective (Wesley Snipes) is called in to investigate the murder of a woman at the White House, he uncovers a complex web of corruption and deceit.'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dwight H. Little'], 'Producers': ['Arnold Kopelson', 'Arnon Milchan'], 'Starring': ['Wesley Snipes', 'Diane Lane', 'Alan Alda']} Review Text: Ok, so elements of the plot are completely preposterous, but if you're willing to deploy a moderate suspension of disbelief, you'll enjoy a very well made thriller. There is action, but not so much that it takes over. It's just a good, tightly played thriller with a couple of clever plot twists. My college-age son and I both enjoyed it quite thoroughly. Review Title: A much better thriller than you might expect. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/11/02 Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Keach'], 'Producers': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Keach', 'Carla Singer'], 'Starring': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Brolin', 'Kari Matchett'], 'Studio': ['Multicom Entertainment Group (MEG)']} Review Text: In a romantic movie you have to like the story and you have to like the principal characters. I found the characters stupid, immature, and quite unlikely to be invited to dinner at my house. I found the story preposterously contrived (never thought I'd write that), and had to turn this off midway and find a nice nature documentary. Review Title: I found neither main character likeable, and the plot was idiotic. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/03/13 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roar Uthaug'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Tim Headington', 'Drew Crevello', 'Cassidy Lange', 'Patrick McCormick', "Denis O'Sullivan"], 'Starring': ['Nick Frost', 'Walton Goggins', 'Kristin Scott Thomas'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Review Text: Firstly, this is a pretty decently made movie in what I call the "old magic ruins" genre. There were a sufficient number of hair-raising thrill rides and narrow escapes to delight all but the most jaded. The whitewater scene isn't believable to anyone who's actually fallen in a raging river (I have), but if you don't think about that it's really quite a good sequence.

And of course I'm an Alicia Vikander fan. I don't know what it is about her, but I find her a delight to watch on the screen in almost anything she's done: here she's competent, likeable, and fairly believable as a tough young woman who's also a loving daughter of a rather oddly neglectful father.

I can't compare it to the previous Lara Croft movie, because I avoided it. Review Title: A decently made movie, and Vikander is quite enjoyable Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

What can I say, I love this movie! A very enjoyable movie. The plot is along familiar lines, but very well done, despite the somewhat fairy tale ending (all the bad people get their comeuppance, the good people triumph). Amy Adams and Eastwood are super as a father-daughter pair trying to connect, and the supporting cast is terrific. A very enjoyable mellow movie (good date movie, perhaps) {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Hare'], 'Producers': ['David Heyman'], 'Starring': ['Ralph Fiennes', 'Rachel Weisz', 'Bill Nighy'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']} Very well-made in a typically Brit style, but the story is stupid and shallow, there's not much to hold your attention. (Unless you're a big fan of the fashionably lefty entertainment crowd's view of the world with the US and Israel as evil partners; I'm not.) If you want a good Brit-style spy thriller, it would be much better to watch Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (either version). Heck, I'd rather watch that for the 7th time than waste time on this one. dumb shallow story, a waste of some good actors {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Doris Day', 'Brenda de Banzie'], 'Studio': ['Universal City Studios Product']} I remembered seeing this some decades ago, when I was quite young, and only vaguely remembered the story, with some scenes rather vivid in my memory. So I watched it again with eager anticipation. Sadly, I was very disappointed. The story is dumb, really really dumb, even for the period. The lead couple (Stewart & Day) behave irrationally, and so does everyone else -- the police, the bad guys, the bystanders -- it's just hard to take. I also thought there was a whiff of "Ugly American" in the behavior of the McKennas, but there's no point belaboring that point in an old movie. It was not a fun revisit. really dumb, doesn't stand the test of time The Brothers Grimm Suspense, Comedy, Dreamlike, Ambitious ['The rollicking tale of two con-artist brothers who sell protection from menacing spirits to gullible small towns - a profitable business until they must battle real evil creatures in a haunted forest!'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Terry Gilliam'], 'Producers': ['John D. Schofield', 'Daniel Bobker', 'Charles Roven', 'Chuck Roven'], 'Starring': ['Matt Damon', 'Heath Ledger', 'Lena Headey']} Oh my goodness, it is really bad! I should have known, its directed by Terry Gilliam, who could take Hamlet and and destroy it completely. (Why anyone hired or funded that man despite his track record of failure is a question that now torments me.)

No, really, it is abysmal, and a colossal waste of great acting talent. The story is haphazard, the acting uncertain, the direction feckless.

Give it a miss, your life will be better for it. Bad, bad, bad. Just avoid. Murder At 1600 Drama, Action, Anxious, Intense ['When a veteran Washington D.C. police detective (Wesley Snipes) is called in to investigate the murder of a woman at the White House, he uncovers a complex web of corruption and deceit.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dwight H. Little'], 'Producers': ['Arnold Kopelson', 'Arnon Milchan'], 'Starring': ['Wesley Snipes', 'Diane Lane', 'Alan Alda']} Ok, so elements of the plot are completely preposterous, but if you're willing to deploy a moderate suspension of disbelief, you'll enjoy a very well made thriller. There is action, but not so much that it takes over. It's just a good, tightly played thriller with a couple of clever plot twists. My college-age son and I both enjoyed it quite thoroughly. A much better thriller than you might expect. {'Content advisory': ['Foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Keach'], 'Producers': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Keach', 'Carla Singer'], 'Starring': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Brolin', 'Kari Matchett'], 'Studio': ['Multicom Entertainment Group (MEG)']} In a romantic movie you have to like the story and you have to like the principal characters. I found the characters stupid, immature, and quite unlikely to be invited to dinner at my house. I found the story preposterously contrived (never thought I'd write that), and had to turn this off midway and find a nice nature documentary. I found neither main character likeable, and the plot was idiotic. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roar Uthaug'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Tim Headington', 'Drew Crevello', 'Cassidy Lange', 'Patrick McCormick', "Denis O'Sullivan"], 'Starring': ['Nick Frost', 'Walton Goggins', 'Kristin Scott Thomas'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Firstly, this is a pretty decently made movie in what I call the "old magic ruins" genre. There were a sufficient number of hair-raising thrill rides and narrow escapes to delight all but the most jaded. The whitewater scene isn't believable to anyone who's actually fallen in a raging river (I have), but if you don't think about that it's really quite a good sequence.

And of course I'm an Alicia Vikander fan. I don't know what it is about her, but I find her a delight to watch on the screen in almost anything she's done: here she's competent, likeable, and fairly believable as a tough young woman who's also a loving daughter of a rather oddly neglectful father.

I can't compare it to the previous Lara Croft movie, because I avoided it. A decently made movie, and Vikander is quite enjoyable
prompt:
Based on this purchase history, analyze and summarize this person's genuine preferences and patterns in under 256 words. Think step by step: 1. First, identify consistent patterns in ratings and sentiments 2. Next, observe common themes across product purposes and use cases 3. Then, note recurring quality preferences and price sensitivity patterns 4. Finally, synthesize these observations into core preferences Remember to: - Focus only on keywords and trends supported by multiple interactions - Avoid repeating specific product names or details - Base conclusions strictly on the provided purchase data Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: Rio Bravo Review Date: 2006/10/27 Store: John Wayne (Actor), Dean Martin (Actor), Howard Hawks (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles Product Description: ['Rio Bravo (Widescreen) (Sous-titres français)'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Howard Hawks', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, DVD, Subtitled, Widescreen, Closed-captioned, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 8, 2001', 'Actors': 'John Wayne, Dean Martin, Ricky Nelson, Angie Dickinson, Walter Brennan', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Unqualified (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'B.H. McCampbell, Jules Furthman, Leigh Brackett', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I first saw this movie in the early 60s, when I was a young kid, and it stayed in my mind. It's that good. I recently saw it with my 11 year old son, and he just loved it; this boy normally won't watch westerns. It's that good.

John Wayne, Dean Martin, Walter Brennan all do a great job. Even Rick Nelson, not someone you'd expect to see in a western, does a solid job. Angie Dickinson is very likable. It all hangs together, and doesn't work too hard at it; just goes down nice and easy. (Ok, I mixed my metaphors, but you get the drift.)

What can I say, I love this movie! If you like the classic ones, buy it, it's worth every penny. Review Title: if you like the classic westerns, this is a must-see, must-own Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: District B13/District 13: Ultimatum 2-Pack Review Date: 2012/03/10 Store: Cyril Raffaelli (Actor), David Belle (Actor), Patrick Alessandrin (Director), Pierre Morel (Director) & 1 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ["Includes: District B13 Paris, 2010. An isolation wall surrounds the ghetto cities of District B13. Within these walls, without effective law enforcement, gang rule is absolute. Damien is a member of an elite police squadron, highly trained in martial arts. He goes undercover to infiltrate a gang in order to defuse a neutron bomb and save District B13 from annihilation. Damien recruits the help of a criminal named Leito - whose only goal is to save his sister from the clutches of the same gang. District 13: Ultimatum Two years have passed since elite police officer Damien Tomasso (Cyril Raffaelli) teamed up with reformed vigilante Leito (David Belle) to save the notorious District 13, a racially charged ghetto populated by violent drug dealing gangs and vicious killers. Despite government promises to maintain order, the state of the district has deteriorated and is causing civil unrest. A group of corrupt cops and elected officials conspire to cash in on the redevelopment of the district by proposing it's destruction under the nuclear air strike. Damien and Leito must join forces again, using their martial arts and unique physical skills, to bring peace to the neighborhood by any means necessary."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MGNO10299BR', 'Director': 'Patrick Alessandrin, Pierre Morel', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '3 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 27, 2010', 'Actors': 'Cyril Raffaelli, David Belle, Philippe Torreton, Daniel Duval, Elodie Yung', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Magnolia Home Ent', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Yes, I do mean that: these are among the best action movies ever made -- but I'll qualify by adding "which involve humans doing athletic things", such as martial arts movies. (I like the other kinds too, BTW.)

But if you enjoy watching incredibly gifted athletes doing great stunts done in a very believable way, and don't mind preposterous plots, then these movies might tickle your fancy. Just being able to watch David Belle (said to be the founder of parkour/parcour) is worth the price in my opinion.

So remember, don't expect any Profound Commentary on the Human Condition (thank goodness). Don't get too hung up on the silliness or the stereotypes, that's part of the fun. Just relax and enjoy great escapist fun with a good companion or two. Review Title: silly plots, but among the best action movies ever made Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/04/20 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Ferland', 'Christine Moore', 'John Polson', 'Ron Fortunato', 'Seith Mann', 'Jerry Levine', 'Larry Teng', 'Lucy Liu', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Andrew Bernstein'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: If you're a fan of the Sherlock Holmes stories, and don't object to a well-done transformation of the theme, then you are likely to really enjoy this series. The acting is superb, the stories are compelling, and the whole thing just reeks of excellence and attention to detail.

I've been a fan of the Holmes stories since I was a little boy, having read all of them multiple times, and have watched the various film versions over the years. I've enjoyed some of them: I'm not a big fan of the Basil Rathbone versions, and I quite disliked the Guy Ritchie/Robert Downey versions. I think that the recent re-imagining done in this series and in the British series (by Gatiss/Moffat, with Benedict Cumberbatch & Martin Freeman) are excellent, and hugely enjoyable if you're not offended by the variation from the canonical texts. Review Title: Very good revised version of Holmes & Watson Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/09/28 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Attenborough', 'Richard'], 'Producers': ['Richard Attenborough'], 'Starring': ['Ben Kingsley', 'Candice Bergen', 'Edward Fox'], 'Studio': ['Classics']} Review Text: Gandhi was human, and had his weaknesses. But you wouldn't know it from this movie, this is about Gandhi the soon-to-revered, and presents him as someone just barely short of being a god. I would have preferred him presented as a great man, with all his compassion and leadership and steadfastness, but also with some human weaknesses.

Further, although I don't want to go into the history in a brief review (there are many authoritative sources for those who might be interested), but the portrayal of events, and of the other important players, is a bit too slick and shallow. It does great disservice to a worldwide audience that is unlikely to hear another version of the story. Review Title: A bit too much worship. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/10/19 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Owen Morris', 'Robert Chetwyn', 'Martyn Friend', 'Ronald Wilson', 'Ken Hannam', 'Christopher Hodson', 'Robert Tronson'], 'Producers': ['Ken Riddington', 'Jonathan Alwyn'], 'Studio': ['BBC']} Review Text: I read all the Allingham books & stories many years ago, and enjoyed them greatly. So I was quite pleased to find these televised versions ... at least, until I started watching them. They are abysmal. The director and the actors seem to have completely missed the spirit of the stories, the acting is wooden, and the whole thing comes across as rather lame.

If you're a Campion fan, give this a miss. If you're not a Campion fan, give it a wide berth. Review Title: poorly done Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/02/28 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Kay', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Allan Kroeker', 'Jamie Barber', 'Emile B. Levisetti', 'Kate Woods', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Christopher Gorham', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Starring': ['Piper Perabo', 'Christopher Gorham', 'Peter Gallagher'], 'Studio': ['USA']} Review Text: The writers didn't even bother reading spy thrillers to learn a bit about spycraft, guess they care more about the soap opera aspects of the show. Piper Perabo is not convincing in the role, she plays it as "sorority girl tries hard in the CIA". The surrounding cast is rather good, they help carry the show, expecially Chris Gorham in the buddy and mentor role (he's rather charming, appeals to both genders in my family).

I gave up after Perabo's character looked confused at an airport briefcase switch (calling it a brush-pass doesn't make it authentic), because more than one person had similar briefcases. Even trainees in an exercise would have planned it better and handled it better. Review Title: lame. really lame. Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/23 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Satsuo Yamamoto'], 'Producers': ['Itsuo Doi', 'Takerô Itô', 'Masaichi Nagata'], 'Starring': ['Raizo Ichikawa', 'Shiho Fujimura', 'Tomisaburo Wakayama'], 'Studio': ['AnimEigo', 'Inc']} Review Text: Dumb story, poor quality film (it's very dark and hard to see). Diehard fans of the genre might be interested for the historical significance of the series, but although I like many Japanese movies of the type (jidaigeki), I found this one heavy going. Review Title: avoid unless you're a true fan of old ninja movies Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/31 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Christopher Menaul', 'Gillies MacKinnon'], 'Producers': ['Lynda La Plante', 'Liz Thorburn'], 'Starring': ['Kelly Reilly', 'Ciaran Hinds', 'Shaun Dingwell'], 'Studio': ['Acorn Media']} Review Text: For some reason I don't quite understand, Brit thrillers are really gory and brutal -- the bad guys like to really hurt and damage people ... especially young women. (I'm trying not to draw broad conclusions from this.) To me that's just a kind of porn, I don't see how it adds entertainment value to a crime drama.

Anyway, the acting and real-world feel of this series is just excellent. Kelly Reilly does a great job of being the bright young constable who isn't always sure of herself, and the other principal characters are very believable. However, the plots are relatively weak (maybe that's why the gore is needed, to heighten the drama?), and the finish doesn't quite live up to the promise.

Just not compelling enough for my tastes, but again, the actors make it worth watching if you have nothing better to do. Review Title: meh (not wonderful, but not terrible, either) Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/04 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Wolfgang Petersen'], 'Producers': ['Dieter Geissler', 'Bernd Eichinger'], 'Starring': ['Alan Oppenheimer', 'Noah Hathaway', 'Barret Oliver']} Review Text: Dumb story, poorly directed and acted, there was really nothing to redeem this horror. I can't believe it got so many good ratings from so many viewers. I feel I need to erase my memory, it was so bad. Review Title: really dumb and poorly done Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Lorenz'], 'Producers': ['Tim Moore', 'Clint Eastwood', 'Michele Weisler'], 'Starring': ['Clint Eastwood', 'Amy Adams', 'Justin Timberlake']} Review Text: Well crafted, well acted, nice mellow story. A very enjoyable movie. The plot is along familiar lines, but very well done, despite the somewhat fairy tale ending (all the bad people get their comeuppance, the good people triumph). Amy Adams and Eastwood are super as a father-daughter pair trying to connect, and the supporting cast is terrific. Review Title: A very enjoyable mellow movie (good date movie, perhaps) Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/25 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Hare'], 'Producers': ['David Heyman'], 'Starring': ['Ralph Fiennes', 'Rachel Weisz', 'Bill Nighy'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']} Review Text: Very well-made in a typically Brit style, but the story is stupid and shallow, there's not much to hold your attention. (Unless you're a big fan of the fashionably lefty entertainment crowd's view of the world with the US and Israel as evil partners; I'm not.) If you want a good Brit-style spy thriller, it would be much better to watch Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (either version). Heck, I'd rather watch that for the 7th time than waste time on this one. Review Title: dumb shallow story, a waste of some good actors Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/09/28 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Doris Day', 'Brenda de Banzie'], 'Studio': ['Universal City Studios Product']} Review Text: I remembered seeing this some decades ago, when I was quite young, and only vaguely remembered the story, with some scenes rather vivid in my memory. So I watched it again with eager anticipation. Sadly, I was very disappointed. The story is dumb, really really dumb, even for the period. The lead couple (Stewart & Day) behave irrationally, and so does everyone else -- the police, the bad guys, the bystanders -- it's just hard to take. I also thought there was a whiff of "Ugly American" in the behavior of the McKennas, but there's no point belaboring that point in an old movie. It was not a fun revisit. Review Title: really dumb, doesn't stand the test of time Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Brothers Grimm Review Date: 2015/08/13 Categories: Suspense, Comedy, Dreamlike, Ambitious Product Description: ['The rollicking tale of two con-artist brothers who sell protection from menacing spirits to gullible small towns - a profitable business until they must battle real evil creatures in a haunted forest!'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Terry Gilliam'], 'Producers': ['John D. Schofield', 'Daniel Bobker', 'Charles Roven', 'Chuck Roven'], 'Starring': ['Matt Damon', 'Heath Ledger', 'Lena Headey']} Review Text: Oh my goodness, it is really bad! I should have known, its directed by Terry Gilliam, who could take Hamlet and and destroy it completely. (Why anyone hired or funded that man despite his track record of failure is a question that now torments me.)

No, really, it is abysmal, and a colossal waste of great acting talent. The story is haphazard, the acting uncertain, the direction feckless.

Give it a miss, your life will be better for it. Review Title: Bad, bad, bad. Just avoid. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Murder At 1600 Review Date: 2015/08/14 Categories: Drama, Action, Anxious, Intense Product Description: ['When a veteran Washington D.C. police detective (Wesley Snipes) is called in to investigate the murder of a woman at the White House, he uncovers a complex web of corruption and deceit.'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dwight H. Little'], 'Producers': ['Arnold Kopelson', 'Arnon Milchan'], 'Starring': ['Wesley Snipes', 'Diane Lane', 'Alan Alda']} Review Text: Ok, so elements of the plot are completely preposterous, but if you're willing to deploy a moderate suspension of disbelief, you'll enjoy a very well made thriller. There is action, but not so much that it takes over. It's just a good, tightly played thriller with a couple of clever plot twists. My college-age son and I both enjoyed it quite thoroughly. Review Title: A much better thriller than you might expect. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/11/02 Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Keach'], 'Producers': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Keach', 'Carla Singer'], 'Starring': ['Jane Seymour', 'James Brolin', 'Kari Matchett'], 'Studio': ['Multicom Entertainment Group (MEG)']} Review Text: In a romantic movie you have to like the story and you have to like the principal characters. I found the characters stupid, immature, and quite unlikely to be invited to dinner at my house. I found the story preposterously contrived (never thought I'd write that), and had to turn this off midway and find a nice nature documentary. Review Title: I found neither main character likeable, and the plot was idiotic. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/03/13 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roar Uthaug'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Tim Headington', 'Drew Crevello', 'Cassidy Lange', 'Patrick McCormick', "Denis O'Sullivan"], 'Starring': ['Nick Frost', 'Walton Goggins', 'Kristin Scott Thomas'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Review Text: Firstly, this is a pretty decently made movie in what I call the "old magic ruins" genre. There were a sufficient number of hair-raising thrill rides and narrow escapes to delight all but the most jaded. The whitewater scene isn't believable to anyone who's actually fallen in a raging river (I have), but if you don't think about that it's really quite a good sequence.

And of course I'm an Alicia Vikander fan. I don't know what it is about her, but I find her a delight to watch on the screen in almost anything she's done: here she's competent, likeable, and fairly believable as a tough young woman who's also a loving daughter of a rather oddly neglectful father.

I can't compare it to the previous Lara Croft movie, because I avoided it. Review Title: A decently made movie, and Vikander is quite enjoyable Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a strong preference for classic films, particularly westerns and action genres, showcasing a nostalgic attachment to generational favorites while appreciating well-executed modern adaptations. They frequently rate well-produced, entertaining content highly (5.0 ratings are common) and enjoy films that feature compelling stories, strong character performances, and engaging visual action. However, when faced with poorly executed narratives or underwhelming portrayals, the person is critical, often assigning low ratings (1.0-2.0).

Regarding quality, the purchaser shows a clear inclination towards well-crafted productions with attention to detail, indicating an appreciation for good cinematography and solid directing, particularly noted in movies like Sherlock adaptations and classic thrillers. Price sensitivity is not explicitly evident in the reviews, but their enthusiasm for cinematic value suggests they would invest in films they view as worth the price, particularly in the context of nostalgia or strong storytelling. 

Reciprocal enjoyment of certain actors, directors, and genres reveals a tendency towards familiar themes while also showing dissatisfaction with shallow plots and poor performances. Overall, this purchasing behavior reflects a consumer who values classic genres and well-acclaimed stories, seeking both entertainment and quality in their film experience.

target_interaction.title: simply awful, really really bad
target_interaction.text: This was a really dumb story, told poorly in a frenetic style, and wouldn't be worth the time if they were paying you to watch it.  Run away, quickly.
description: An assassin is given a lethal dose of poison that will kill him in one hour unless he can keep his adrenaline pumping long enough to find an antidote or his killer, not necessarily in that order. Jason Statham and Amy Smart star in this frenetic thriller.
